docs.title: Welcome!
docs.text:
To the all new Catalyst Studios Guides site! This site will strive to create high quality guides about our packs along with guides on popular mods!

This site is a work-in-progress so there will be missing information!

Here you'll find guides for our main modpacks such as Little Bit Large!

docs.title: Pack Requirements
docs.text:
• A 3rd-party launcher that will download, install, and run our packs
  • A PC with at least 16gb of RAM

docs.title: Launchers
docs.text:
CurseForge, ATLauncher, Prism, GDLauncher.

Catalyst Studios | GitHub | Discord

docs.title: About
docs.text:
Catalyst Studios is a community hub where modpack developers and collaborators can host their projects under one roof while also developing and launching our flagship packs alongside them!

Catalyst Studios | GitHub | Discord

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Guides on how to contribute to Catalyst Guides or to Catalyst Studios!

Catalyst Studios | GitHub | Discord

docs.title: Contributing Guidelines
docs.text:
Guidelines
  1. Do NOT touch mkdocs.yml, pyproject.toml, or workflow files unless given explicit permission AND you know what you're doing.
  2. Do NOT republish Catalyst Guides live on another site.
  3. You should not get any warning or errors when running uv run mkdocs serve | build.
    1. Resolve/get help for any warnings/errors before pushing.
    2. Never disable strict mode for any reason unless you have consulted with the team.
  4. Do NOT delete or drastically change another author's work (unless they're typos or factual errors) without permission from the original author.
  5. No inappropriate content (Profanity, NSFW, Paid content)
    1. Violaters will be banned from the repository.
  6. All guides should follow the Writing Your Guide format.
  7. File and folder names must be lowercase with no spaces. Image files can use camelCase.
  8. Eliminate/minimize external links to content like document, images, or videos.
    1. This helps to keep everything together for offline use.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.1+
  • Github Desktop, Git CLI, or Visual Studio Code
  • UV Package Manager

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: You will be required to Serve (Live preview) and Build this site.

docs.title: Fork and Enable Workflows
docs.text: Fork the Catalyst Guides repository, then enable GitHub Workflows.

docs.title: Clone main Branch
docs.text:
Now you'll want to Clone your forked repository using your preferred program.

GitHub Desktop

Go to File Clone repository... OR do Ctrl+Shift+O and select your Catalyst Guides fork. (I put _arc for my own sorting purposes)

I recommend putting the repository under C:/Users/yourPCName for easy access

Need help? Check out GitHub Desktop's official docs!

Visual Studio Code
  1. Go to your Catalyst Guides fork and click <> Code and copy the HTML link.
  2. In VsCode do Ctrl+` to open the Terminal
  3. Type git clone then press space, then paste the link.

Need help? Check out this Geeks for Geeks article!

docs.title: Installing UV and Plugin Dependencies
docs.text:
Install UV
winget install --id=astral-sh.uv  -e

Catalyst Guides has a few Python dependencies that provide additional features for making guides.

Install Dependencies
uv sync

docs.title: Serve (Live Preview)
docs.text:
While you're making your guide, you can preview it by hosting the Catalyst Guides site locally at 127.0.0.1:8000 or localhost:8000. This will also let you know about any warnings or errors that occur during the build process.

uv run mkdocs serve

docs.title: Writing Your Guide
docs.text:
All guides must be Markdown files (.md).

To make a guide, make a new .md file within the docs/ folder. Once created, you can view the new page using Serve.

Check out the formatting guide for every formatting option available to you in Catalyst Guides!

docs.title: Guide Format
docs.text:
Warning

DON'T use Tab to indent a list of authors in the authors section of document headers. It WILL cause syntax errors.

Use a single space instead.

The highlighted lines are required!

exampleGuide.md
---
title: documentName
description: some description
authors:
 - John
 - Jane
 - Bob
---

# Guide Title

Content.

## Second Header

More content.

> modName | [Curseforge](legacy.curseforge link)

docs.title: Making Navigation files (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want to list the pages of your guide in its own order, you can create a .pages file to list an order rather than the default alphabetical order. You can also give pages different names.

Warning

DON'T use Tab to indent a list of pages in .pages files. It WILL cause syntax errors.

Use a single space instead.

The highlighted lines are required!

.pages File Example
nav:
 - index.md
 - about.md

# You can give names to pages
 - Home: index.md
 - About: about.md

# Navigation sub-sections can be created
 - Home: index.md
 - User Guide:
   - Writing your docs: writing-your-docs.md
   - Styling your docs: styling-your-docs.md
 - About:
   - License: license.md
   - Release Notes: release-notes.md

# You MUST put 3 dots at the end of each .pages file
# This will list any pages that aren't defined above
 - ...

docs.title: Build
docs.text:
Before making a Commit, you should build the site which will compile Markdown into HTML.

This should succeed without any warnings or errors before making a commit.

uv run mkdocs build

docs.title: Making a Commit
docs.text: Commiting sends your changes to your fork of Catalyst Guides on GitHub. From there you can then submit a Pull Request.

docs.title: Commit with GitHub Desktop
docs.text:
All changes made will be selected by default, if you do not want to commit some changes, deselect those.

  1. Fill out the Summary and Description on the bottom left, click Commit to main when you're ready to commit.
  2. If you made a mistake, you can undo the commit in the bottom left. Otherwise click Push origin to push the commit to GitHub.

docs.title: Making a Pull Request (PR)
docs.text:
When you submit a PR, you're requesting us to Pull changes from your repository to ours and then deployed on the live Catalyst Guides site.

After making your Commit, go to your fork of Catalyst Guides on GitHub and you'll see a yellow banner with a buttom that says Compare & pull request.

Click it, then add a Title and what you've changed in the Description, then click Create pull request.

docs.title: More Resources
docs.text:
Most of everything that you need to know is explained on this page or in the Formatting Examples section.

If you have any question, feel free to join the Discord!

  • Markdown Basics
  • Mkdocs Writing Your Docs
  • Material Reference Docs
  • Material PyMdown Extensions
  • PyMdown Extensions Docs

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
My header is displaying above the page title.
  • You likely put a Tab indent in your list of authors.
  • Remember, only use a single space when indenting

![](img/faqHeader.png){style='border: 1px solid orange'}

My authors are being spelled out letter by letter.
  • You didn't put a space after the hyphen and before the author name.
  • It is - authorName, not -authorName

![](img/faqAuthor.png){style='border: 1px solid orange'}

My locally hosted preview won't refresh with changes.
  • Check your PowerShell console output and see if it produces any warning or error. It will tell you exactly what is wrong.
  • Most likely, you have a misspelled file name or you have the incorrect path to an image.

![](img/faqWarning.png){style='border: 1px solid orange'}

Catalyst Guides | GitHub | Discord

docs.title: Formatting Examples
docs.text:
These are examples on how to use the various formatting plugins that are available to you in Catalyst Guides.

Most of the references are from their respective plugin documentation pages. I put them all here so you don't have to go easter egg hunting on the various documentation sites.

docs.title: Highlighting Changes
docs.text:
Text can be deleted and replacement text added. This can also be combined into onea single operation. Highlighting is also possible and comments can be added inline.

Formatting can also be applied to blocks by putting the opening and closing tags on separate lines and adding new lines between the tags and the content.

Paragraph 1 with a line break Paragraph 2

  1. Item 1
  2. Item 2
    1. Item 1
    2. Item 2
  1. item i
  2. item j
\[ \cos x=\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(-1)^k}{(2k)!}x^{2k} \]

The homomorphism \(f\) is injective if and only if its kernel is only the singleton set \(e_G\), because otherwise \(\exists a,b\in G\) with \(a\neq b\) such that \(f(a)=f(b)\).

docs.title: Little Bit Large
docs.text:
The Little Bit Large pack sets out to do what every kitchen sink should be doing, but has recently failed to achieve; to take you from the start to end of a Minecraft version with new content added regularly, ensuring you're playing a modpack centered around quality, stability, and multiplayer-based playthroughs.

There will be some custom content in this pack alongside popular mods we all know and love, without gating you unnecessarily along the way.

Refamiliarise yourself with mods such as Mystical Agriculture, Applied Energistics 2 (+Addons), Mekanism, Biomes o' Plenty, and more! As content is released for 1.21.1, it will be added swiftly and seamlessly, all thanks to unification being handled using KubeJS and Almost Unified.

World generation should always be kept simple, yet feel fun to explore and traverse through, which is why we have gone with the fan favourite of Biomes o' Plenty. By sticking with one world generation mod, we can offer a clean, efficient world that will not lag you out when your friends explore deeper into the world. This reiterates our commitment to a quality modpack perfect for playing with friends.

Little Bit Large | CurseForge | GitHub
